Some of the staff that hadn’t seen Solskjær in at least four years were touched that he remembered their children’s names. One coach at academy level said he had spoke to Ole more in one morning than he did with Mourinho in 18 months #mulive [james ducker]

Sob

At half-time vs Reading, Solskjær was unhappy with the performance and screamed directly at his players for a minute or two to make his point - and then calmly discussed how #mufc would tackle the second half #mulive [james ducker]

Solskjær organised an 8v8 tournament in Dubai. One team was academy graduates and De Gea, another was older players and the third was everyone in-between. It got so competitive that the players asked to continue when it finished #mulive [james ducker]

Solskjær attended the #mufc xmas party on his first day. Staff had no idea he would be attending and serenaded him with his song when Ed Woodward invited him on stage. He told the crowd “if you can’t enjoy yourself at United, where can you enjoy yourself?” #mulive [james ducker]

Solskjær used the Dubai training camp to work on fitness and tactics vs Tottenham, PSG and Liverpool. It also worked as an invaluable bonding exercise. Observers say training appeared more thorough and more fun #mulive [james ducker]
Solskjær welcomes and encourages Mike Phelan’s input and ideas. Both operate open door policies and want everyone to feel wanted and important #mulive [james ducker]
With Solskjaer, there has been a shift towards #mufc focusing on their own strengths & where they can hurt the opposition. Players are more inclined to take risks because they know their mistakes will not be picked apart for days in front of the group #mulive [james ducker]
